clinical_study.brief_title: Video Versus Conversational Contraceptive Counseling During Maternity Hospitalization
clinical_study.official_title: Video Versus Conversational Contraceptive Counseling During Maternity Hospitalization: The COMSE Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized trial comparing LARC uptake and satisfaction after either video or conversational-based contraceptive counseling for pregnant women in labor.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a multi-center randomized, controlled trial examining contraceptive counseling in the setting of long-acting reversible contraception (LARC) uptake and immediate provision. At two urban public hospitals with large adolescent populations, participants were randomized to a structured, in-person conversation with a trained counselor or a 14-minute video providing the same information. Both participant groups were provided written materials and both had the opportunity to ask questions of the counselor. The total time to complete counseling was measured, as well as participant satisfaction, pre- and post-intervention contraceptive knowledge, and intended postpartum contraceptive method.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two groups randomized to counseling type.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following the intervention, an average of less than 30 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Duration of counseling in minutes (from initiation of counseling to conclusion of all questions answered.) The clock was not stopped for breaks, which were allowed as needed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Score measured after completion of the knowledge questionnaire, on average less than one hour
secondary_outcome.description: Mean total correct answer to 7 multiple-choice contraceptive knowledge questions. Total possible score is 0-7, with 7 representing 100% correct answers.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at the time of hospital discharge, on average less than 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects initiating IUD or implant prior to hospital discharge

arm_group.description: The video group watched a 13.75 minute video of a local Colombian counselor reading a script of the same information provided by conversational counseling and had a chance to ask questions at the end.
The conversation group participated in a structured, face-to-face conversation with a trained counselor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Live pregnancy >20 weeks gestation
- Admission to maternity ward for labor
- Age >14
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pain >=8 on Wong-Baker FACES pain scale

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual sites hold the paper data under monitoring plan through their site IRB (University de Antioquia). They entered de-identified data electronically into REDCap for our use for analysis. We have shared aggregate analysis with the individual sites.
